intro: Monelasmum glaucum, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features silver-gray foliage with a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically pale blue to lavender, appearing in clusters during the summer months. Monelasmum glaucum is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and ability to support local pollinators.
